name: Pizza, Beer and WNC GDG!
description: I'll provide pics and updates from the GDG NA Summit to be held at Google HQ on 5/15/2017. We'll also continue brainstorming Jim's STEM Artisan application, and discuss any other topics which attendees would like to cover in upcoming meetings. Topics of interest include: Android/VR app development, Artificial Intelligence/Home Automation, Google Cloud and any other Google platform of interest.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville
description:
[Update: I need to move the Meetup to Thursday as we are going out of town and I may not be back in time on Monday. Also, there are other Asheville tech Meetups on Tues/Wed which I plan to attend.]

We'll plan to discuss options for introducing software development in Buncombe County schools. Other topics of interest include: Android/VR app development, Artificial Intelligence/Home Automation, Google Cloud and any other Google platform of interest.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville - Topic: Python
description: *Please plan to bring a laptop as we'll go through a beginner Python course at https://developers.google.com/edu/python/.* We'll also discuss options for introducing software development in Buncombe County schools. Other topics of interest include: Android/VR app development, Artificial Intelligence/Home Automation, Google Cloud and any other Google platform of interest.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville
description: We will be building a Google AIY kit with the Daryl Rue's comp sci class.
how_to_find_us: Go through main entrance at the Nesbitt STEM Academy and ask for Daryl Rue.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville
description:
Google Fonts - Why you should be using them on your website.

Daryl Rue will be giving a brief demo of the Google Fonts interface and walking through how easy it is to find and deploy that perfect font without having to worry about backup fonts, and backups to the backups, and the infamous font-family tree.

NOTE: We decided to change the location of this meeting to Thirsty Monk in Biltmore Park because it has lots of parking, huge tables, and really good beer. :) We'll see how it goes!
how_to_find_us: Look for the big table with a laptop on it!

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville
description:
For this meetup we want to brainstorm and discuss the direction(s) in which we should take the group. We need a permanent venue, we need to nail down our purpose, how we fit in to the Asheville area, what we want to accomplish, etc. Some initial ideas are: a tech learning community, an advocacy / support group, a bridge between those interested in entering the tech world and the local tech companies who need them, tech interest / enthusiast group, a hub for local tech events (DevFests), etc. Also note: we are not limited to Google products and platforms. Just like us, Google is primarily interested in impacting communities and improving the quality of life for everyone, whether or not that involves something that has Google in the name.

Everyone is welcome. Come and bring your ideas!
how_to_find_us: We will try to snag the big table in the corner. There will be a GDG Asheville sign on the table.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville
description: We are going to continue the discussion about what kinds of topics and presentations we want to offer in the future. We overcame our biggest hurdle already with finding a permanent venue at the Collider (read Kevin is awesome)! If there is interest, I will give a brief demo and explanation of Flutter in preparation for our next event, which will be an Extended I/O featuring Flutter and will include a demo and code lab. Looking forward to seeing everyone!
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville - Introducing Flutter!
description:
What if you could make mobile apps that compile natively to both Android and IOS with no sacrifice in terms of performance or features? And what if you could do it in record time with a developer-friendly interface? Meet Flutter - Google's newest mobile development platform. If you are a developer, employer, business owner, or just curious, come out and see what Flutter is all about.

Daryl Rue will be building an app in real time, after which there will be an optional code lab where you can try it for yourself! (bring your laptop)

NOTE: If you want to participate in the code lab, you will need to install Flutter(https://flutter.io/get-started/install/) and an editor(https://flutter.io/get-started/editor/) beforehand. Let us know if you need any help!

UPDATE: Free beer, pizza, and a raffle for a Google Home Mini! (2 winners)
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Intro to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
description: Niles Black will lead us through an introduction of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. No coding necessary - this will be a high-level overview based on his experience as an AI professional. If you want to learn more about AI or are just curious about what it is, come out and join us for what will be a great talk on a highly-relevant topic. See you there!
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Planning meeting for the upcoming series on AI and Tensorflow.js
description:
We are going to plan for the upcoming AI series.

What we have so far:
-Start with Tensorflow.js
-Geared toward all who have some basic coding knowledge. Basic knowledge of javascript is helpful.

Ideas in the works:
-Collaborative project on GitHub that could be linked to for a personal portfolio
-Above project would apply Tensorflow.js to a real-world problem
-Other ideas you bring

If you are interested in potentially being a part of this series, come out and join us. If you have any questions about it feel free to message us. See you there!

name: Learn Artificial Intelligence with TensorFlow.js - Free Course
description:
You've probably been hearing a lot about artificial intelligence. How would you like to be one of the few who can actually DO it? Here's your chance! This series will span 4 meetups and will give you the understanding and skills to apply machine learning to real-world problems. All you need is a laptop and an editor/IDE. We'll be working in Visual Studio Code, which is a free, lightweight and powerful IDE - perfect for our purposes here. Here is the download link:

https://code.visualstudio.com/download

Some basic knowledge of JavaScript will be helpful, but not necessary.

Friendly PSA: This will look awesome on a resume! And if you are interested in continuing the pursuit of AI after this course, some of us are planning to go deeper and collaborate on a project that will be hosted on GitHub. This would give you the ability to show off your skills with a link from your online portfolio.
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Google Developer Groups Asheville
description: This will be part 2 of our AI series using Tensorflow.js. We will build on what we did last month and get into some more complex examples, also continuing the discussion about a potential collaborative project. If you didn't make it last month, it's not too late to jump in. See you there!
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Learn Python! - Google Developers Group Asheville
description:
We are starting a 5-class series in which we will learn how to program in Python. In this first class we will cover what Python is, why we want to learn it, and how to get it set up on your computer.

You should come if:
1. You want to learn how to program. Python is an excellent first language and this class will be accessible to beginners and experienced programmers alike.

2. You already know how to program, but want to learn Python.

3. You are interested in AI and Machine Learning, but need to learn Python to get started.

This is a free course open to everyone. All who finish the course will receive a certificate that can go on a resume.

Bring a laptop and we'll see you there!
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Learn Python! - Google Developers Group Asheville
description: This is the second class in a 5-class series on programming in Python. If you missed the first class but still want to jump in, it's not too late! Just send us a message and we will add you to the roster and help you get setup. This is a free course for which you will earn a certificate and have a project on GitHub that can be used with your online portfolio.
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Google Developers Group Asheville
description: This is the third class in our 5-class series on Python. Come ready to program. Things are getting serious! ;)
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

name: Google Developers Group Asheville
description: Christmas party! OK, we are still doing the Python class, but you can choose whether you want to do the program during this meetup or later at home. Feel free to bring a friend for the festivities! And if you are NOT doing the Python class, but want to come for pizza, beer, prizes, and to meet cool people, you are also welcome! See you there!
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

description: This is our final Python class. We will also discuss what's coming next. See you there!
how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.

how_to_find_us: Go in the glass doors right across Haywood St. from Pritchard Park (there is a Wells Fargo ATM right at the entrance), then follow the signs to the 4th floor. You can park on a nearby street or in the Rankin Avenue Garage.
